articles.title: Seminar on DPRK's Joint New Year Editorial Held in Democratic Congo
Joint New Year Editorial Studied Abroad
DPRK Policy of National Reunification and Foreign Policy Supported
articles.content:
DPRK Policy of National Reunification and Foreign Policy Supported 
     Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- The International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea issued a statement on January 3 in support of the joint New Year editorial published in the DPRK. The committee supported the DPRK's policy of independent national reunification and foreign policy.
  The joint editorial encourages the forces struggling for peace and reunification of Korea and aspiring after a just and peaceful world, the statement said.    
  It called upon the progressive forces to widely introduce the joint editorial in order to help the world people have full understanding of the Korean nation's sufferings resulting from the division and intensify international solidarity with the Korean people in their struggle to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country at an early date.

articles.title: Socialist Emulation Called for
articles.content:
Socialist Emulation Called for 
    Tanchon, January 11 (KCNA) -- The workers of the Komdok Mining Complex challenged all the industrial workers across the country to a socialist emulation of loyalty to carry out this year's national economy plan ahead of schedule and celebrate the 60th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea which falls in October with brilliant labor achievements.
 This challenge was made at the meeting of employees of the complex, the nation's leading nonferrous mineral ore producer, held on Tuesday to vow to thoroughly implement the militant tasks set forth in the joint New Year editorial. The meeting called upon all the employees to turn out as one in a general onward march for the Songun revolution this significant year which will witness a great turn in the Korean revolution and in the drive to build a great prosperous powerful nation.    
 At the meeting miners of Komdok resolved to attain this year's target of mineral production ahead of schedule through a high-pitched drive for increased production while building more promising faces to mine ore with high content rate with the patriotic enthusiasm to make a leaping advance in the efforts to build a rich and powerful country.

DPRK Minister of Construction and Building-Materials Industries Dies
articles.content:
DPRK Minister of Construction and Building-Materials Industries Dies
    Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- Jo Yun Hui, minister of Construction and Building-Materials Industries, who is deputy to the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, died of heart attack at the age of 67 on Jan. 11.
 The DPRK Supreme People's Assembly and Cabinet issued an obituary of Jo Yun Hui Tuesday.    
 According to it, he devoted all his wisdom and energies to augmenting the economic 
potential of the country, holding important posts in the field of construction for years.

Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Jo Yun Hui
    Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il sent a wreath today to the bier of Jo Yun Hui, minister of Construction and Building-Materials Industries, who is deputy to the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, expressing deep condolence over his death.

articles.title: Congratulations to Chief of Palestinian National Authority
articles.content:
Congratulations to Chief of Palestinian National Authority
    Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a congratulatory message to Mahmoud Abbas, chairman of the Executive Committee of the Palestine Liberation Organization, on his election as the chief of the Palestinian National Authority.
 Expressing belief that friendship and solidarity between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, too, the message wished him success in his work to win back the legitimate national rights of the Palestinian people.

articles.title: Congratulations to Romanian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Romanian President
    Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Traian Basescu on his election as president of Romania.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms in the interests of the two peoples in the future, too, the message sincerely wished the president success in his responsible work for the stability and prosperity of Romania.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Congratulates Romanian Prime Minister
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Congratulates Romanian Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, January 12 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju sent a congratulatory message to Calin Popescu-Tariceanu on his appointment as prime minister of Romania.
 The message sincerely wished him great success in the performance of his responsible new duty for the economic development of the country and the wellbeing of the people.
 Meanwhile, Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a similar message to Mihai Razvan Ungureanu on his appointment as foreign minister of Romania.    
 Expressing belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two peoples would more favorably develop, the message sincerely wished him great success in his work for the country's entry into the EU and the elevation of its international prestige.
